elements.name: vaadin-grid-pro-edit-column
elements.description:
`<vaadin-grid-pro-edit-column>` is a helper element for the `<vaadin-grid-pro>`
that provides default inline editing for the items.

__Note that the `path` property must be explicitly specified for edit column.__

#### Example:
```html
<vaadin-grid-pro items="[[items]]">
 <vaadin-grid-pro-edit-column path="name.first"></vaadin-grid-pro-edit-column>

 <vaadin-grid-column>
   ...
```

attributes.name: resizable
attributes.description: When set to true, the column is user-resizable.

attributes.name: frozen
attributes.description:
When true, the column is frozen. When a column inside of a column group is frozen,
all of the sibling columns inside the group will get frozen also.

attributes.name: frozen-to-end
attributes.description:
When true, the column is frozen to end of grid.

When a column inside of a column group is frozen to end, all of the sibling columns
inside the group will get frozen to end also.

Column can not be set as `frozen` and `frozenToEnd` at the same time.

attributes.name: hidden
attributes.description: When set to true, the cells for this column are hidden.

attributes.name: header
attributes.description: Text content to display in the header cell of the column.

attributes.name: text-align
attributes.description:
Aligns the columns cell content horizontally.
Supported values: "start", "center" and "end".

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: Width of the cells for this column.

attributes.name: flex-grow
attributes.description: Flex grow ratio for the cell widths. When set to 0, cell width is fixed.

attributes.name: path
attributes.description: JS Path of the property in the item used for the editable content.

attributes.name: auto-width
attributes.description:
Automatically sets the width of the column based on the column contents when this is set to `true`.

For performance reasons the column width is calculated automatically only once when the grid items
are rendered for the first time and the calculation only considers the rows which are currently
rendered in DOM (a bit more than what is currently visible). If the grid is scrolled, or the cell
content changes, the column width might not match the contents anymore.

Hidden columns are ignored in the calculation and their widths are not automatically updated when
you show a column that was initially hidden.

You can manually trigger the auto sizing behavior again by calling `grid.recalculateColumnWidths()`.

The column width may still grow larger when `flexGrow` is not 0.

attributes.name: editor-type
attributes.description:
Type of the cell editor component to be rendered. Allowed values:
- `text` (default) - renders a text field
- `checkbox` - renders a checkbox
- `select` - renders a select with a list of items passed as `editorOptions`

Editor type is set to `custom` when `editModeRenderer` is set.

attributes.name: editor-value-path
attributes.description: Path of the property used for the value of the editor component.

attributes.name: theme
attributes.description: The theme variants to apply to the component.

properties.name: resizable
properties.description: When set to true, the column is user-resizable.

properties.name: frozen
properties.description:
When true, the column is frozen. When a column inside of a column group is frozen,
all of the sibling columns inside the group will get frozen also.

properties.name: frozenToEnd
properties.description:
When true, the column is frozen to end of grid.

When a column inside of a column group is frozen to end, all of the sibling columns
inside the group will get frozen to end also.

Column can not be set as `frozen` and `frozenToEnd` at the same time.

properties.name: hidden
properties.description: When set to true, the cells for this column are hidden.

properties.name: header
properties.description: Text content to display in the header cell of the column.

properties.name: textAlign
properties.description:
Aligns the columns cell content horizontally.
Supported values: "start", "center" and "end".

properties.name: headerRenderer
properties.description:
Custom function for rendering the header content.
Receives two arguments:

- `root` The header cell content DOM element. Append your content to it.
- `column` The `<vaadin-grid-column>` element.

properties.name: footerRenderer
properties.description:
Custom function for rendering the footer content.
Receives two arguments:

- `root` The footer cell content DOM element. Append your content to it.
- `column` The `<vaadin-grid-column>` element.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the cells for this column.

properties.name: flexGrow
properties.description: Flex grow ratio for the cell widths. When set to 0, cell width is fixed.

properties.name: renderer
properties.description:
Custom function for rendering the cell content.
Receives three arguments:

- `root` The cell content DOM element. Append your content to it.
- `column` The `<vaadin-grid-column>` element.
- `model` The object with the properties related with
  the rendered item, contains:
  - `model.index` The index of the item.
  - `model.item` The item.
  - `model.expanded` Sublevel toggle state.
  - `model.level` Level of the tree represented with a horizontal offset of the toggle button.
  - `model.selected` Selected state.
  - `model.detailsOpened` Details opened state.

properties.name: path
properties.description: JS Path of the property in the item used for the editable content.

properties.name: autoWidth
properties.description:
Automatically sets the width of the column based on the column contents when this is set to `true`.

For performance reasons the column width is calculated automatically only once when the grid items
are rendered for the first time and the calculation only considers the rows which are currently
rendered in DOM (a bit more than what is currently visible). If the grid is scrolled, or the cell
content changes, the column width might not match the contents anymore.

Hidden columns are ignored in the calculation and their widths are not automatically updated when
you show a column that was initially hidden.

You can manually trigger the auto sizing behavior again by calling `grid.recalculateColumnWidths()`.

The column width may still grow larger when `flexGrow` is not 0.

properties.name: editModeRenderer
properties.description:
Custom function for rendering the cell content in edit mode.
Receives three arguments:

- `root` The cell content DOM element. Append your editor component to it.
- `column` The `<vaadin-grid-pro-edit-column>` element.
- `model` The object with the properties related with
  the rendered item, contains:
  - `model.index` The index of the item.
  - `model.item` The item.
  - `model.expanded` Sublevel toggle state.
  - `model.level` Level of the tree represented with a horizontal offset of the toggle button.
  - `model.selected` Selected state.
  - `model.detailsOpened` Details opened state.

properties.name: editorOptions
properties.description:
The list of options which should be passed to cell editor component.
Used with the `select` editor type, to provide a list of items.

properties.name: editorType
properties.description:
Type of the cell editor component to be rendered. Allowed values:
- `text` (default) - renders a text field
- `checkbox` - renders a checkbox
- `select` - renders a select with a list of items passed as `editorOptions`

Editor type is set to `custom` when `editModeRenderer` is set.

properties.name: editorValuePath
properties.description: Path of the property used for the value of the editor component.

elements.name: vaadin-grid-pro
elements.description:
`<vaadin-grid-pro>` is a high quality data grid / data table Web Component with extended functionality.
It extends `<vaadin-grid>` and adds extra features on top of the basic ones.

See [`<vaadin-grid>`](https://cdn.vaadin.com/vaadin-web-components/23.2.0/#/elements/vaadin-grid) documentation for details.

```
<vaadin-grid-pro></vaadin-grid-pro>
```

### Internal components

In addition to `<vaadin-grid-pro>` itself, the following internal
components are themable:

- `<vaadin-grid-pro-edit-checkbox>` - has the same API as [`<vaadin-checkbox>`](https://cdn.vaadin.com/vaadin-web-components/23.2.0/#/elements/vaadin-checkbox).
- `<vaadin-grid-pro-edit-text-field>` - has the same API as [`<vaadin-text-field>`](https://cdn.vaadin.com/vaadin-web-components/23.2.0/#/elements/vaadin-text-field).
- `<vaadin-grid-pro-edit-select>` - has the same API as [`<vaadin-select>`](https://cdn.vaadin.com/vaadin-web-components/23.2.0/#/elements/vaadin-select).

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The number of root-level items in the grid.

attributes.name: page-size
attributes.description: Number of items fetched at a time from the dataprovider.

attributes.name: item-has-children-path
attributes.description: Path to an item sub-property that indicates whether the item has child items.

attributes.name: item-id-path
attributes.description: Path to an item sub-property that identifies the item.

attributes.name: multi-sort
attributes.description: When `true`, all `<vaadin-grid-sorter>` are applied for sorting.

attributes.name: multi-sort-priority
attributes.description:
Controls how columns are added to the sort order when using multi-sort.
The sort order is visually indicated by numbers in grid sorters placed in column headers.

By default, whenever an unsorted column is sorted, or the sort-direction of a column is
changed, that column gets sort priority 1, thus affecting the priority for all the other
sorted columns. This is identical to using `multi-sort-priority="prepend"`.

Using this property allows to change this behavior so that sorting an unsorted column
would add it to the "end" of the sort, and changing column's sort direction would retain
it's previous priority. To set this, use `multi-sort-priority="append"`.

attributes.name: column-reordering-allowed
attributes.description: Set to true to allow column reordering.

attributes.name: drop-mode
attributes.description:
Defines the locations within the Grid row where an element can be dropped.

Possible values are:
- `between`: The drop event can happen between Grid rows.
- `on-top`: The drop event can happen on top of Grid rows.
- `on-top-or-between`: The drop event can happen either on top of or between Grid rows.
- `on-grid`: The drop event will not happen on any specific row, it will show the drop target outline around the whole grid.

attributes.name: rows-draggable
attributes.description: Marks the grid's rows to be available for dragging.

attributes.name: all-rows-visible
attributes.description:
If true, the grid's height is defined by its rows.

Effectively, this disables the grid's virtual scrolling so that all the rows are rendered in the DOM at once.
If the grid has a large number of items, using the feature is discouraged to avoid performance issues.

attributes.name: enter-next-row
attributes.description:
When true, pressing Enter while in cell edit mode
will move focus to the editable cell in the next row
(Shift + Enter - same, but for previous row).

attributes.name: single-cell-edit
attributes.description:
When true, after moving to next or previous editable cell using
Tab / Shift+Tab, it will be focused without edit mode.

When `enterNextRow` is true, pressing Enter will also
preserve edit mode, otherwise, it will have no effect.

attributes.name: edit-on-click
attributes.description:
When true, the grid enters cell edit mode on a single click
instead of the default double click.

attributes.name: theme
attributes.description: The theme variants to apply to the component.

properties.name: activeItem
properties.description:
The item user has last interacted with. Turns to `null` after user deactivates
the item by re-interacting with the currently active item.

properties.name: items
properties.description: An array containing the items which will be passed to renderer functions.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The number of root-level items in the grid.

properties.name: pageSize
properties.description: Number of items fetched at a time from the dataprovider.

properties.name: dataProvider
properties.description:
Function that provides items lazily. Receives arguments `params`, `callback`

`params.page` Requested page index

`params.pageSize` Current page size

`params.filters` Currently applied filters

`params.sortOrders` Currently applied sorting orders

`params.parentItem` When tree is used, and sublevel items
are requested, reference to parent item of the requested sublevel.
Otherwise `undefined`.

`callback(items, size)` Callback function with arguments:
  - `items` Current page of items
  - `size` Total number of items. When tree sublevel items
    are requested, total number of items in the requested sublevel.
    Optional when tree is not used, required for tree.

properties.name: itemHasChildrenPath
properties.description: Path to an item sub-property that indicates whether the item has child items.

properties.name: itemIdPath
properties.description: Path to an item sub-property that identifies the item.

properties.name: expandedItems
properties.description: An array that contains the expanded items.

properties.name: detailsOpenedItems
properties.description: An array containing references to items with open row details.

properties.name: rowDetailsRenderer
properties.description:
Custom function for rendering the content of the row details.
Receives three arguments:

- `root` The row details content DOM element. Append your content to it.
- `grid` The `<vaadin-grid>` element.
- `model` The object with the properties related with
  the rendered item, contains:
  - `model.index` The index of the item.
  - `model.item` The item.
  - `model.level` The number of the item's tree sublevel, starts from 0.
  - `model.expanded` True if the item's tree sublevel is expanded.
  - `model.selected` True if the item is selected.

properties.name: selectedItems
properties.description: An array that contains the selected items.

properties.name: multiSort
properties.description: When `true`, all `<vaadin-grid-sorter>` are applied for sorting.

properties.name: multiSortPriority
properties.description:
Controls how columns are added to the sort order when using multi-sort.
The sort order is visually indicated by numbers in grid sorters placed in column headers.

By default, whenever an unsorted column is sorted, or the sort-direction of a column is
changed, that column gets sort priority 1, thus affecting the priority for all the other
sorted columns. This is identical to using `multi-sort-priority="prepend"`.

Using this property allows to change this behavior so that sorting an unsorted column
would add it to the "end" of the sort, and changing column's sort direction would retain
it's previous priority. To set this, use `multi-sort-priority="append"`.

properties.name: columnReorderingAllowed
properties.description: Set to true to allow column reordering.

properties.name: cellClassNameGenerator
properties.description:
A function that allows generating CSS class names for grid cells
based on their row and column. The return value should be the generated
class name as a string, or multiple class names separated by whitespace
characters.

Receives two arguments:
- `column` The `<vaadin-grid-column>` element (`undefined` for details-cell).
- `model` The object with the properties related with
  the rendered item, contains:
  - `model.index` The index of the item.
  - `model.item` The item.
  - `model.expanded` Sublevel toggle state.
  - `model.level` Level of the tree represented with a horizontal offset of the toggle button.
  - `model.selected` Selected state.

properties.name: dropMode
properties.description:
Defines the locations within the Grid row where an element can be dropped.

Possible values are:
- `between`: The drop event can happen between Grid rows.
- `on-top`: The drop event can happen on top of Grid rows.
- `on-top-or-between`: The drop event can happen either on top of or between Grid rows.
- `on-grid`: The drop event will not happen on any specific row, it will show the drop target outline around the whole grid.

properties.name: rowsDraggable
properties.description: Marks the grid's rows to be available for dragging.

properties.name: dragFilter
properties.description:
A function that filters dragging of specific grid rows. The return value should be false
if dragging of the row should be disabled.

Receives one argument:
- `model` The object with the properties related with
  the rendered item, contains:
  - `model.index` The index of the item.
  - `model.item` The item.
  - `model.expanded` Sublevel toggle state.
  - `model.level` Level of the tree represented with a horizontal offset of the toggle button.
  - `model.selected` Selected state.

properties.name: dropFilter
properties.description:
A function that filters dropping on specific grid rows. The return value should be false
if dropping on the row should be disabled.

Receives one argument:
- `model` The object with the properties related with
  the rendered item, contains:
  - `model.index` The index of the item.
  - `model.item` The item.
  - `model.expanded` Sublevel toggle state.
  - `model.level` Level of the tree represented with a horizontal offset of the toggle button.
  - `model.selected` Selected state.

properties.name: allRowsVisible
properties.description:
If true, the grid's height is defined by its rows.

Effectively, this disables the grid's virtual scrolling so that all the rows are rendered in the DOM at once.
If the grid has a large number of items, using the feature is discouraged to avoid performance issues.

properties.name: enterNextRow
properties.description:
When true, pressing Enter while in cell edit mode
will move focus to the editable cell in the next row
(Shift + Enter - same, but for previous row).

properties.name: singleCellEdit
properties.description:
When true, after moving to next or previous editable cell using
Tab / Shift+Tab, it will be focused without edit mode.

When `enterNextRow` is true, pressing Enter will also
preserve edit mode, otherwise, it will have no effect.

properties.name: editOnClick
properties.description:
When true, the grid enters cell edit mode on a single click
instead of the default double click.

events.name: cell-activate
events.description: Fired when the cell is activated with click or keyboard.

events.name: column-resize
events.description: Fired when a column in the grid is resized by the user.

events.name: cell-focus
events.description:
Fired when a cell is focused with click or keyboard navigation.

Use context property of @see {@link GridCellFocusEvent} to get detail information about the event.

events.name: column-reorder
events.description: Fired when the columns in the grid are reordered.

events.name: grid-dragend
events.description: Fired when the dragging of the rows ends.

events.name: grid-dragstart
events.description: Fired when starting to drag grid rows.

events.name: grid-drop
events.description: Fired when a drop occurs on top of the grid.

events.name: cell-edit-started
events.description: Fired when the user starts editing a grid cell.

events.name: item-property-changed
events.description:
Fired before exiting the cell edit mode, if the value has been changed.
If the default is prevented, value change would not be applied.
